title: On the Influence of Context Size and Model Choice in Retrieval-Augmented Generation Systems
author: Juraj Vladika (Technical University of Munich), Florian Matthes (Technical University of Munich)
relevance_why: This paper explores retrieval-augmented generation systems, which could potentially enhance performance in audio-related tasks through improved model configurations and retrieval strategies.
background: Retrieval-augmented generation systems improve language model responses by dynamically retrieving relevant information, making them suitable for tasks requiring factual knowledge.
contribution: This paper introduces a systematic evaluation of RAG components including context size and model choice, aimed at optimizing performance for long-form question answering tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods have focused primarily on short answers and questions with well-defined singular context snippets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This study expands the evaluation to include varying context sizes and different foundational models, providing a more comprehensive understanding of RAG system performance.

key_innovation: By analyzing how varying context sizes influence the performance of multiple large language models, this research addresses gaps in understanding RAG dynamics for nuanced tasks.
real_world_impact: Findings may inform the design of more effective AI systems for knowledge-intensive applications, enhancing user interactions with technology through improved factuality and context usage.
limitations: No mention of explicit limitations; however, findings may not generalize beyond the studied datasets.

new_terms.retrieval-augmented generation: **Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)** refers to systems that integrate retrieval components into generative processes, improving the information quality of generated responses.
new_terms.context saturation: **Context saturation** occurs when additional context does not enhance performance and may even degrade it due to information overload.

open_sourcing: Code available in a public repository on GitHub.
